summary: This is an FBI FD-302 form documenting an interview with Janusz Banasiak, a former household employee for Jeffrey Epstein. Banasiak describes his hiring process, job duties, the household manual, message logs, and his awareness of the investigation and Epstein's legal troubles. He worked for Epstein from 2005 to 2017.

persons.name: Janusz Banasiak
persons.role: Former household employee for Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Interviewed by the FBI about his employment with Jeffrey Epstein from 2005 to 2017. He was responsible for household maintenance, driving, and managing petty cash.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation. Banasiak's employer who he drove, shopped for, and maintained properties for. Described as not friendly with staff and constantly traveling.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Interviewed Banasiak for the job in her New York townhouse and was a primary source of instructions on Epstein's preferences and household procedures.

connections.description: Banasiak was employed by Epstein as a household manager and driver from 2005 to 2017.
Maxwell interviewed Banasiak for the job and was a direct supervisor, giving him instructions on how to manage the household for Epstein.
Maxwell acted as Epstein's assistant, handling hiring and conveying his preferences to staff like Banasiak.

events.title: Banasiak hired by Epstein
events.description: Janusz Banasiak is hired through an agency, interviewed by Ghislaine Maxwell and then Jeffrey Epstein, and moves to Florida to work.

events.title: Banasiak's employment period
events.description: Banasiak works for Epstein, maintaining his Florida property, driving him and his assistants, and managing household expenses.

events.title: Police execute search warrant
events.description: Police arrive at Epstein's Florida property with a search warrant while Banasiak is present. He learns of the investigation for the first time.

events.title: Epstein pleads guilty
events.description: Banasiak reads in the news that Epstein pleaded guilty to solicitation of underage prostitution. He later drives Epstein to court for an appearance.

events.title: FBI interview of Banasiak
events.description: Janusz Banasiak is interviewed by the FBI in West Palm Beach, Florida, regarding his employment with Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: Lexington Avenue and Park Avenue (Maxwell's townhouse)
keyFacts: Janusz Banasiak worked as a household employee for Jeffrey Epstein from 2005 to 2017, living in a small house on Epstein's Florida property.
Banasiak was interviewed and hired by Ghislaine Maxwell, who gave him detailed instructions on Epstein's preferences via a household manual.
Banasiak first learned of the investigation into Epstein when police executed a search warrant at the Florida property.
Banasiak confirmed his handwriting in message logs from 2004-2005, which were used to record phone calls to Epstein's residence.
After Epstein's arrest and guilty plea, he cut employee salaries by 10% and never restored the pay.
